intro: Commelina mascarenica, commonly known as the Mascarene spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the Mascarene Islands in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features striking blue-violet flowers with white markings, typically arranged in clusters at the ends of its stems. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in coastal areas and dense vegetation. Its foliage is lance-shaped, with a waxy texture that helps it retain moisture in its native habitat.
